decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The site has an extant prior approval granted under ref: P/0466/21/PRIOR for conversion of the existing offices located on the first and second floors to residential. Therefore, the proposal fails to comply with the requirements of paragraph Class AA.1(za) of Class AA, Part 20, of Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 as amended, which states that development is not permitted under Class AA if the permission to use the buildings as a dwellinghouse has been granted only by virtue of Class MA of Part 3 of Schedule 2. 
Reason : 2 - Notwithstanding the submitted drawings, the proposed additional two storeys, by reason of its design and appearance failing to sympathetically relate to, and assimilate with the existing appearance of the host building, would result in a contrived and incongruous form of development which would adversely impact upon the overall design, character and appearance of the existing building in the streetscene. The development would, therefore, not represent an appropriate high quality of design, as required by National Planning Policy Framework (2021) (Paragraphs 126,127 and 134), Policy D3 (D(1) and D(11)) of The London Plan (2021), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies (2013) and would not be within the tolerances of Condition AA.2(1)(e) Class AA, Part 20 of Schedule 2 of the General Permitted Development Order (2015) as amended.
description: Additional two Storeys (height 6 m) of development containing 14 flats on a detached commercial or mixed use building - maximum overall height 16.3 m (Prior approval of  transport and highways impacts; air traffic and defence asset impacts; contamination risks; flooding risks; the external appearance of the building; fire escape; waste storage; the provision of adequate natural light in all habitable rooms of the new dwellinghouses; impact on the amenity of the existing building and neighbouring premises;  impacts of noise from any commercial premises on the intended occupiers of the new dwellinghouses;  impacts of the introduction of, or an increase in, a residential use of premises in the area on the carrying on of any trade, business or other use of land in the area and impact on a protected view)
